verbs.description: unsay (third-person singular simple present unsays, present participle unsaying, simple past and past participle unsaid)

entries.meaning: To cause something not to have been said; to make it so that one never said something (since this is physically impossible, usually in the subjunctive).
examples: I wish I could unsay that.
There are some things I'd like to unsay... to my boss... right before he decided to fire me.
